intro: Tenoria protracta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tenoria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
